Crystalline Conflict
Overview
Crystalline Conflict is a tactical confrontation between teams Astra and Umbra. A maximum of ten players─five per team─may participate in total.
Match Types

There are three types of matches in Crystalline Conflict─casual, ranked, and custom. The primary difference among these is that ranked matches affect players' risers and tiers, and thus their overall ranks as well.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Casual Matches■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Losing or winning a casual match has no effect on riser or tier.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Ranked Matches■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Loss or victory in these competitive matches affects participants' risers and tiers. Thus, when playing a ranked match, you will be matched with players of similar tier and riser to your own. Furthermore, a match can only take place on selected data centers, which alternate each season.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Custom Matches■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Custom matches allow participants to customize their group, arena, and other match settings. Members may be recruited via the Party Finder. The results of a custom match will not be reflected on Player PvP profiles, count toward achievements, or affect risers or tiers. Additionally, PvP EXP, Series EXP, Wolf Marks, and similar rewards cannot be earned during custom matches.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Arenas■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Both casual and ranked matches are held in a variety of different arenas. The staging ground currently in play rotates periodically according to Earth time.
Risers and Tiers
A player's riser and tier indicate their demonstrated skill in ranked Crystalline Conflict matches.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Tier■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Each player will rate in one of six tiers─Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond, or Crystal. Players ranked in or below the Platinum tier will never drop down to a lower tier during that season. However, it is possible to drop to a lower tier from the Diamond or Crystal tiers.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Riser■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>The sub-levels within each tier are called “risers.” The number of risers varies per tier, with three risers each for Bronze and Silver, four for Gold and Platinum, and five within the Diamond tier. Regardless of tier placement, it is always possible for players to drop down to a lower riser.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Rising Stars■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>When you win a ranked match, you will gain one Rising Star. Similarly, a loss will remove one Star. Once you have earned the maximum three Rising Stars in one riser, an additional win will allow you to move up a riser. Winning three or more matches in a row while in the Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, or Diamond tier will apply a streak bonus, netting you two Rising Stars per win.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■The Crystal Tier■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Once you have reached Crystal, the highest tier, victory and defeat will be reflected by your Crystal Credit, rather than Rising Stars. The amount of Credit you earn or forfeit in matches is determined by the difference in average Credit between your team and the opposing team. Streak bonuses do not apply to Crystal Credit.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Resets■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>At the end of each season, the tier and risers of all participants will be lowered, the amount by which will vary between seasons.
Rules of Engagement
Success in Crystalline Conflict depends on each team's ability to gain control of the tactical crystal and deliver it to the goal.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Victory Conditions■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>To win, one team must move the tactical crystal from the center of the field to the goal point. If neither team accomplishes this during the time limit, victory will be awarded to the team with greatest progress. “Progress,” displayed on the HUD throughout the match, indicates the maximum progress a team has made in bringing the tactical crystal toward their goal at any point during the match─as opposed to its current position relative to either goal─and thus will never decrease even should the crystal be reclaimed by the opposing team.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If neither team reaches the goal by the time limit, and progress for both teams is tied or the team with lower progress score is currently within the ring around the tactical crystal, the match will proceed into overtime. During overtime, the victory conditions differ depending on both teams' progress.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Should your team have the greater progress score upon the commencement of overtime, you must keep the entire opposing team out of the ring around the tactical crystal for three seconds to win.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Should the opposing team have the greater progress score upon the commencement of overtime, you must beat their progress score during overtime to win.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Should the teams have equal progress scores upon the commencement of overtime, you must beat the opposing team's progress score during overtime to win.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Should neither team fulfill victory requirements by the end of overtime, the following conditions will apply:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・The team with the greater progress score will be awarded victory.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・If teams have equal progress scores, the team with the greater progress score upon the commencement of overtime will be declared the winner.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・If teams had equal progress scores upon the commencement of overtime and have equal progress scores by the end of overtime, victory will be awarded to the team that moved the tactical crystal closest to the goal point. If the tactical crystal remains at the center of the field, the match will end in a draw.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■The Tactical Crystal■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>The all-important object placed at the arena's centerpoint is called the “tactical crystal.” It will remain bound until the first 20 seconds of the match have passed.

Once the tactical crystal is unbound, a ring will appear at its base. Should one team be fully in control of this ring─with no members of the opposing team present within its bounds─that team will be able to move the crystal.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The crystal can only be moved along the crystal line─a dedicated path within the arena. It will move faster when:<hex:02100103>・It reaches a stretch of the line through which the same team has moved it before.<hex:02100103>・The controlling team's progress is less than that of the opposing team.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Checkpoints■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Checkpoints can be found halfway between the centerpoint and each team's goal.

Upon reaching a checkpoint, the tactical crystal's progress will be halted temporarily. The team attempting to clear the checkpoint must remain in the crystal's ring until the Clear Progress gauge reaches 100%, at which point the crystal can once again be moved.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The Clear Progress gauge will fill when the team attempting to clear the checkpoint has more players in the crystal's ring than the opposing team, and the gauge will fill faster the larger this discrepancy is.
Features

Crystalline Conflict arenas include a variety of tactically useful elements to make matches more dynamic. These include arena events, designed to complement the specific arena in which they occur, as well as the following features:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Medicine Kits■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Each arena comes equipped with medicine kits. Accessing these kits will restore a player's HP.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Medicine kits cannot be claimed by those whose HP is at 100%, and each can only be claimed by one player. Once a kit has been claimed, a replacement will be generated after a set period of time has passed.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Sprint Zones■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Certain stages feature unique paths suited to running. Entering these “sprint zones” will grant the effect of Swift Sprint, greatly increasing player movement speed.
<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Jump Glyphs■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Stepping on a jump glyph will rapidly transport you to a specific location on the field.
Arenas
The Palaistra
Inspired by the iconic architecture of the Northern Empty, this glamour-woven arena features no specialized gimmicks─so there can be no doubt that to the superior team goes the glory.
The Volcanic Heart
This staging ground lies at the foot of a volcano no less volatile for its artificial nature. If you can't take the heat, abandon all hope of victory.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Eruptions■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>The Volcanic Heart periodically erupts, scattering self-destructing bombs across the field. Those who fail to avoid their explosive radii will take damage.

Bomb cores will remain at the site of bombs' destruction, granting those who acquire them the following:<hex:02100103>・An effect increasing damage dealt for a short time. Stacks up to 10 times.<hex:02100103>・A boost to the limit gauge.
Cloud Nine
Though the cloudtops may be illusory, the turbulence in this arena feels real enough! Ride its winds to victory...or defeat.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Turbulence■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Players cast up into the air by turbulence will take damage upon being returned unceremoniously to the ground. However, they may acquire black chocobo feathers while in the air, granting them the following:<hex:02100103>・A soft landing, nullifying the typical damage taken from turbulence.<hex:02100103>・An effect increasing attack speed and movement speed for a short time.<hex:02100103>・A boost to the limit gauge.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The locations of black chocobo feathers are indicated by markers on the ground. Those who do not wish to go flying can negate the effects of turbulence by using Guard.

Turbulence also leaves behind a twister and gale sphere at the site where it occurred. Stumbling into these twisters will result in damage and knockback. If your Guard is active, it will be depleted by the twister.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Gale spheres, on the other hand, will greatly increase movement speed. Only one player may use any given gale sphere, and they will reappear after a fixed period of time while turbulence is active.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Participation Requirements■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Crystalline Conflict matches can be entered via the Duty Finder. To register, participants must use a job of level 30 or above, and may not be part of a preformed party.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Role Requirements■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>There are no restrictions on the balance of roles within a team. However, there cannot be two players of the same job on one team.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Time Limit■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>A standard match lasts five minutes. In the event that neither team claims victory in the allotted time, the match will go into overtime, which may last up to ten minutes.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Retaliation■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>Incapacitated players will be returned to their base, where they will be allowed to rejoin combat after a short delay─however, this delay increases with each incapacitation. Players will return to their senses with HP and MP fully restored and all action recast timers reset. Furthermore, they will be invulnerable so long as they remain at their base. This effect will be lost upon returning to the battlefield.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>■Other Restrictions■<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103>The use of the following is prohibited while participating in Crystalline Conflict:<hex:02100103>　・Chat (aside from Quick Chat)<hex:02100103>　　* Not restricted for custom matches.<hex:02100103>　・Class or job changes<hex:02100103>　・Gear changes<hex:02100103>　・Items<hex:02100103>　・Chocobo companions<hex:02100103>　・Mounts<hex:02100103>　・Teleportation<hex:02100103>　・Return

Island Sanctuary allows you to create your own personal paradise amidst the natural beauty of the Cieldalaes.

Island endeavors are primarily solo experiences, and can be enjoyed at your own pace.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Once you have taken steps to ready your island for visitors, you may invite friends, party members, and members of your free company to spend time in your sanctuary.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Your island has room for up to 15 adventurers to explore at a time.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Realizing visions will help you make your sanctuary the best it can be.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Visions will appear as objectives in your duty list. As you realize visions, additional goals and development features will become available to you.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Your sanctuary rank indicates your experience with subsisting in an island environment and improving your personal sanctuary.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Earn island experience by engaging in various activities on your island,<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> and your sanctuary rank will increase accordingly. The higher your rank, the more features and options will become available to you.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Please note that you may reach no higher than sanctuary rank 3 until certain visions are realized.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The islekeep's index is an island-specific HUD feature that allows you to confirm important information, switch gameplay modes, and manage your island's various features.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

■Mode<hex:02100103>Your selected mode influences how you interact with features and creatures on your island. Additional modes will become available to you as you learn more about the island and add features to your sanctuary.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Switch modes by selecting the Mode icon via the islekeep's index and then choosing the appropriate option for your desired activity.

Certain modes require you to choose a specific item to use. In such cases, an Item icon will appear in the islekeep's index. Select this icon to change your chosen item.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Main Menu<hex:02100103>The main menu consists of buttons by which you can confirm important information and manage aspects of your island. As you unlock more features, additional buttons will be added.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Sanctuary Rank<hex:02100103>Confirm your current sanctuary rank by checking the data below the main menu on the islekeep's index.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Island EXP<hex:02100103>The amount of island experience you have accrued is also displayed with your sanctuary rank.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Seafarer's Cowries<hex:02100103>Seafarer's cowries are a Cieldalaes-specific currency. The amount in your possession is displayed next to the blue icon at the bottom of the islekeep's index.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Islander's Cowries<hex:02100103>Islander's cowries are another Cieldalaes-specific currency. The amount you possess is indicated next to the green icon.
<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The “Gather” feature allows you to collect resources and materials on your island.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Gather materials on your island by enabling Gather mode from the islekeep's index and interacting with the resources you encounter.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>While some materials may be collected with your bare hands, they are limited in variety and utility.<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03> For others, tools are required.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> The islekeep's stone hatchet, for example, will enable you to gather timber.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Some resources may be interacted with even if you have no tool in hand, so go forth and gather!<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>
Gathered materials will be recorded in the Sanctuary Gathering Log.
Access the Sanctuary Gathering Log from the islekeep's index to confirm resource locations and necessary tools.
<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The Sanctuary Crafting Log enables you to create certain items, such as tools, from the materials you gather on your island.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>
Access the Sanctuary Crafting Log from the islekeep's index to begin crafting.

Select a recipe to confirm the required materials, then use the Craft button to create the item.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Items will always be successfully crafted.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>
<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The hideaway is your base of operations on your island.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Here you may build facilities, care for animals, grow crops, and more!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Select the Manage Hideaway option on the islekeep's index to review the layout, status, and construction possibilities of your hideaway.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>You may expand your hideaway as you make progress perfecting your island sanctuary.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Speak to the pathological pathfinder standing before any portion of hideaway-adjacent land to learn what requirements must be met for hideaway expansion. Upon fulfilling these requirements and paying a fee of seafarer's cowries, you will unlock additional space for your hideaway.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The general appearance of your hideaway will automatically change each time you renovate the cozy cabin.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You may customize the appearance of your hideaway by accessing the cozy cabin's logboard and selecting Change Hideaway Appearance.
Hideaway customization does not require any time to complete and will be reflected immediately.
<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>With the help of architecturally savvy and industrious mammets, a variety of structures can be built on your island.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Begin construction by accessing the logboard in front of a vacant plot.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Facilities available for construction differ depending on plot size.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

By selecting your desired structure, you may confirm what materials are required and how long construction will last. Once you possess all necessary materials, select Construct to begin the process.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Construction is performed by a talented team of mammets and will be completed after a predetermined period of time. Finalize construction by accessing the logboard in front of your new structure after the mammets have finished their work.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You may check the logboard during construction to confirm current progress and estimated time of completion.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>You may move an existing facility to a different plot<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> on your island by accessing its logboard and selecting “Move facility.”<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※The cozy cabin cannot be moved.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

Select your desired location and click Yes when prompted to finalize the move. Please note that if your desired location already has a facility built upon it, the two facilities will switch places.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Moving facilities does not require any time to complete and will be reflected immediately.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Renovation allows you to upgrade various structures on your island.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> Renovation is accessible via each upgradable facility's logboard.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Increasing your sanctuary rank will allow you to renovate your facilities to higher levels.

By accessing the logboard of your desired structure, you may confirm what materials are required and how long renovation will last. As you upgrade your facilities, it will take less time to complete construction or renovations for buildings of levels lower than your highest attainable level.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Once you possess all necessary materials, select Renovate to begin the process.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Renovation is performed by a talented team of mammets and will be completed after a predetermined period of time. Finalize renovation by accessing the logboard in front of your upgraded structure after the mammets have finished their work.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You may check the logboard during renovation to confirm current progress and estimated time of completion. You may also continue using workshops and granaries as usual, even while they are being renovated.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>You may customize a facility so that it reflects a previous appearance.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> Access the logboard and select “Change facility appearance.” to view what options are currently available.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Changes made to facility appearance will not affect functionality or gameplay.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>
Facility appearance customization does not take any time to complete and will be reflected immediately.

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The workshop provides a place for mammets to create handicrafts out of the materials obtained on your island.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>

After conveying a schedule of production to the tactful taskmaster, isleworks handicrafts will be automatically created and sold for a profit of seafarer's cowries. Make the most of the workshop's various features, and you'll soon be swimming in a sea of cowries!
From sundry items to foodstuffs and furnishings, isleworks handicrafts are specialty goods created from your island's natural resources.

The following elements are crucial to isleworks handicraft creation:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Materials<hex:02100103>The production of handicrafts requires materials that can be gathered from the wilds of your island, the crops you grow, or the animals you keep.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Time<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The time it takes to create a given item is displayed in hours.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> In order to produce a given handicraft, a sufficient block of time must be available in the workshop's agenda.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Please refer to “Agenda” for further details.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Value<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The selling price of each handicraft is displayed in seafarer's cowries.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> As your workshop's level increases, so too will the value of the items it produces.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Category<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Every isleworks handicraft falls under a certain category, which in turn affects efficiency bonuses.<hex:02100103>※Please refer to “Efficiency Bonuses” for further details.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Additional handicrafts will become available for creation as your sanctuary rank increases.

The workshop's agenda indicates which isleworks handicrafts will be created at what time.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Speak with the tactful taskmaster near your cozy cabin to access the Isleworks Agenda interface, from which you may create, review, and edit the schedule of production.
The following statuses may be reflected on the agenda.

①Pre-production<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Handicrafts in pre-production have been scheduled, but not yet created.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> Production will begin at the time indicated on the agenda.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>②In Production<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Handicrafts in production are currently being created.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>③Insufficient Material<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>You do not have the materials required for creating these handicrafts.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>④Shipped<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Shipped handicrafts have been completed and sold.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Setting the Agenda<hex:02100103>To schedule handicrafts for production, select the plus button on the Isleworks Agenda interface.

Handicrafts available for production will be displayed in the Set Agenda window. By selecting your desired item followed by the Schedule button, creation of the handicraft will be added to the agenda.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>You may schedule handicrafts for production even if you do not currently have the necessary materials.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> As long as sufficient materials are acquired by the time of scheduled production, the handicraft will be created automatically.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Clearing the Agenda<hex:02100103>Handicrafts not yet in production may be erased from the schedule.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>While you can also clear the agenda of items currently in production, please note that the necessary materials will still be used and cannot be recovered.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>To erase all items in a given cycle, select the Clear Agenda button in the upper right-hand corner of the Isleworks Agenda interface.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※Please refer to “Cycles & Seasons” for further details on cycles.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Registering Presets<hex:02100103>You may save a workshop's schedule for a given cycle and apply it to other workshops or future cycles.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Select the item from which the agenda preset should start, and choose “Register Preset” from the subcommands.<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>※You may save a maximum of 10 agenda presets.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>To apply an agenda preset to your schedule, choose the “Select Preset” subcommand from the plus button on the Isleworks Agenda interface. There is no limitation to the number of times you can apply a preset.

■Cycles and Seasons<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The workshop's agenda is comprised of cycles and seasons.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>One cycle lasts 24 hours (Earth time), and one season lasts for seven cycles. <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>In other words, cycles are equivalent to Earth-time days and seasons to Earth-time weeks.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Agendas for the current season and next season may be viewed from the Isleworks Agenda interface.

■Production and Shipping<hex:02100103>Mammets will automatically proceed with scheduled handicraft creation and shipping if all necessary materials have been acquired by the start of production. Additionally, efficiency bonuses are only applicable within a given cycle, and will not carry over to the following cycle.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Groove<hex:02100103>When efficiency bonuses are triggered, your mammets' happy production groove will intensify. As such, adventurer plate portraits will revert to default settings, requiring you to create a new image that reflects your character's updated appearance.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Please note that after using Fantasia, your adventurer plate will become temporarily hidden from other players. Isleworks for Beginners
What Happens at the Workshop?
Scheduling Basics
Congratulations! You have built your very own workshop, where you may make and sell isleworks handicrafts.

Isleworks handicrafts are artisanal goods made from your island's natural resources. Traders in Limsa Lominsa will be happy to pay a sum of seafarer's cowries in exchange for these goods, allowing you to live your dream of running an island-based small business!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>In case breaking a sweat isn't your cup of tea, fear not─a team of mammets will create and ship all handicrafts for you. You need only speak to the tactful taskmaster to design the production schedule, then sit back, relax, and watch the cowries pour in.

Managing a workshop's schedule may seem daunting at first, but once you grasp the basics, handicraft production will feel as refreshing as a tropical breeze! As an example, let's try scheduling the production of an isleworks potion.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Press Plus to Schedule<hex:02100103>The plus button on the Isleworks Agenda screen indicates an opening in your schedule. Select this button to get started.

Tricks of the Trade

Earnings are not only influenced by factors like workshop level and groove, but the popularity and current supply of handicrafts.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Navigating the nuances of market demand will offer you even greater profits than simply renovating your facilities or activating efficiency bonuses.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Market Research<hex:02100103>You may review the current state of the market by selecting the “Review Supply & Demand” button in the top right-hand corner of the Isleworks Agenda interface.

・Popularity<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Items will be in one of the following four states of popularity: Very High, High, Average, and Low.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The more popular an item is, the higher it will sell for.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Popularity may change at the beginning of a new season, but it will remain constant throughout that season.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>・Supply<hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Items will be in one of the following fives stages of supply: Nonexistent, Insufficient, Sufficient, Surplus, and Overflowing.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The less abundant an item is, the higher it will sell for.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Furthermore, the supply of handicrafts may change each cycle according to both commercial trends in Limsa Lominsa and the type/amount of items you sell from your island.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>You can check shifts in demand from the previous cycle to the current one by referencing the “Demand Shift” column of the Supply & Demand interface.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If you produce too much of the same product, the market will be inundated with it, causing supply to become “Overflowing.” Pay special attention to changes in the market when looking to create a large amount of a single kind of handicraft.

Mastering the intricacies of isleworks production and trade begins with a close examination of the materials available to you and the strategic implementation of efficiency bonuses.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>For those islekeeps who feel like they have a firm grasp on the basics, the following tips will help you take your island industry─and earnings─to the next level.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Popular Items Sell Even Better When Scarce<hex:02100103>When a handicraft has High or Very High popularity, the inclination may be to produce large quantities of it, as popularity increases selling price. Efficiency Bonuses
The Path to Profits

With an agenda in hand and a team of eager mammets at your disposal, you are free to make any and all handicrafts your heart desires. However, a very special bonus awaits those who choose their schedules cleverly.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>The efficiency bonus will double the production of a given handicraft without requiring additional materials or production time.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Doubling the production of a handicraft means you will have two handicrafts to export, and basic mathematics tells us that two handicrafts will sell for twice as much as one handicraft will. So what are you waiting for? Activate those efficiency bonuses by following the steps below!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Activating Efficiency Bonuses<hex:02100103>All handicrafts belong to at least one item category, such as “Concoctions” or “Confections.”<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Efficiency bonuses are activated by scheduling the production of similarly categorized items in direct succession.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>For example, an isleworks potion and isleworks firesand are both classified as “Concoctions.” By scheduling production of isleworks firesand right after your isleworks potion, you will activate an efficiency bonus that creates two pinches of isleworks firesand with the same time and materials it would normally take to make one!<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>But you don't have to keep track of all your bonuses in that steel-trap mind of yours─the text “Efficiency Bonus!” will appear on the agenda for items that will be produced twice as a result of your clever scheduling.

But wait! There's more.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>What if you scheduled an isleworks potion, followed by a pinch of isleworks firesand, followed by <hex:021A020203>another<hex:021A020103> isleworks potion?<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Thanks to efficiency bonuses, what might have been only three handicrafts has now been expanded to five! Think of the profits! Keep in mind both the type and order of handicrafts you add to your agenda, and you will be swimming in an abundance of seafarer's cowries in no time.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■Limitations of the Efficiency Bonus<hex:02100103>Unfortunately, due to the peculiarities of the mammet's psyche, your tiny workers will not be nearly as excited making the same item twice in a row. While an isleworks potion/isleworks firesand combination will earn you an efficiency bonus, an order of isleworks potion/isleworks potion will get you nothing but some blinking and basic adherence to general protocol.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>In other words, only different items belonging to the same category can activate efficiency bonuses.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>When aiming for bonuses, be sure you are scheduling different handicrafts. The Palace of the Dead
Entry

You may enter the Palace of the Dead solo or in a party of up to four players. When speaking with the Wood Wailer expeditionary captain, you will be given the option to enter with a fixed party or a matched party via the matching system.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>To create a fixed party, the party leader must speak with the Wood Wailer expeditionary captain after forming a party of up to four players. Please note that all party members must have at least one unused save slot.
Progress

Players must activate the Cairn of Passage that appears on each floor in order to progress. These stones can only be activated when all nearby enemies are defeated.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Especially powerful enemies can be found on certain floors. Players can save their progress in the Palace of the Dead upon defeating these enemies. In the event all party members are incapacitated, however, you will be removed from the Palace of the Dead and must resume from your last save point.
Saving Progress

Players can save their progress in the Palace of the Dead by defeating the boss enemies that appear on certain floors. After saving one's progress, players can resume their foray into the Palace of the Dead immediately or return at a later time. Players who choose to leave and return later will start on the floor following their last save point.
Leveling Up

Players who enter from floor 1 will start at level 1 regardless of their current class or job level. Players who enter from floor 51, however, will start at level 60.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>If your job or class level is below 90 upon entering the deep dungeon, experience points will be rewarded based on progress.
Learning Actions

As you gain levels within the Palace of the Dead, you will also relearn actions and traits for your selected class or job. You will continue to acquire actions and traits as you normally would even should your level in the Palace of the Dead exceed your actual class or job level.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Any role actions acquired prior to entering the Palace of the Dead will be available immediately upon entry.
Precautions

It is possible to receive a score for your performance in the Palace of the Dead. In order to do so, you must enter with a fixed party.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>A fixed party is also required to challenge floor 100 and beyond. Moreover, your Party KO count must be zero. Please note that the Party KO count will also increase in the event your party abandons the duty.
Resetting Progress
Resetting Progress

It is possible to reset your progression in the Palace of the Dead, allowing you to re-enter the deep dungeon starting from floor 1. Although floor progression and character level will be reset, aetherpool arm and gear strength will remain unchanged. Please note, however, that data cannot be restored once deleted.
Fixed Parties
Disbanding Fixed Parties

It is possible to convert fixed party save data to matched party save data, allowing you to be matched automatically with other players via the matching system. Please note that all special items (pomanders) will be lost upon converting your data.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Once saved data from a fixed party is converted, it can only be used when selecting matched party. It cannot be restored to its original state.
Entry After Disbanding

Although players can no longer enter as a fixed party after converting their saved data, it is still possible to create preformed parties as long as the party is formed before entering the Palace of the Dead. The progression of all party members must be identical when doing so. Any open party slots will be filled automatically via the matching system.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Please note that a matched party cannot be used to challenge floors beyond floor 100.
Party Progression

Players who have not progressed to the same floor cannot enter the Palace of the Dead together as a party. Those on earlier floors must use the matching system on their own. Once all players have reached the same floor, they can proceed together until floor 100 by forming a party and choosing to enter as a matched party.
Aetherpool Gear
About Aetherpool Gear

Players must use aetherpool armor and arms in place of normal gear when inside the Palace of the Dead. They will be equipped automatically upon entering, and can then be strengthened as you progress through the dungeon.
Upgrading Aetherpool Gear

Aetherpool gear can be enhanced by accessing silver coffers. These coffers are found randomly on each floor and after defeating certain enemies.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The maximum strength of aetherpool gear may be restricted depending on your class or job level and current progression in the deep dungeon. This can be confirmed when viewing the Character Info window.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Aetherpool gear enhancements will not carry over from one deep dungeon to another.
Gear Restrictions

Under certain circumstances, you may be unable to join a matched party due to insufficient gear strength. In such cases, it may be necessary to resume your exploration of the Palace of the Dead from floor 1 to ensure your aetherpool gear is of sufficient strength.
Pomanders
Using Pomanders

Players will, on occasion, obtain pomanders from treasure coffers in the Palace of the Dead. These items can be used by all party members once acquired. They have various effects such as revealing the entirety of a map or increasing the number of treasure coffers on a given floor. Effective use of these items will help ensure the situation is always to your advantage.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Pomanders that affect the map cannot be overwritten with the same item when their effect is already in play. Please note, however, that they will still be consumed upon use.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Pomanders cannot be taken outside of the deep dungeon. When in a matched party, they will be reset each time you enter the dungeon.
The Accursed Hoard
About the Accursed Hoard

When exploring the Palace of the Dead, players will, on occasion, find pieces of the Accursed Hoard─treasure hidden and buried by the undead. Once found, players must remain stationary at the treasure's location for a fixed period of time to unearth the coffer.
Finding the Accursed Hoard

Though it is not difficult to unearth pieces of the Accursed Hoard, their location cannot be discerned with the naked eye alone.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Players must make use of a certain pomander in order to sense the presence of hidden pieces of the Accursed Hoard.
Appraisal

Pieces of the Accursed Hoard obtained in the Palace of the Dead will be moved to your inventory upon saving your progress and exiting the dungeon. To ascertain the true value of this treasure, you must speak with the expedition bishop at Quarrymill to have it properly appraised.
Scores
Individual and Party Scores

When entering the deep dungeon as a fixed party, you will receive scores based on a number of factors such as highest floor reached and number of enemies slain. You will be assigned separate scores for both individual and team performance.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Please note that you cannot earn credit for previous floors when starting from floor 51. Starting from floor 1 will ensure the highest score possible.
Rankings

Your highest score from the deep dungeon will be saved and can be viewed at any time by speaking with the Wood Wailer expeditionary captain. Scores that exceed a certain threshold will be made viewable on the rankings page of the Lodestone.

Using Gear Sets

A variety of different features exist to help you find the perfect look for your character. This guide explains how each of these customization options function.

To cast a glamour, select <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Character<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in the main menu and open the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Actions & Traits<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> window, then select the Cast Glamour action under the <hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>General<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> tab. You can also use this action from the subcommand menu of the item you wish to glamour.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>From the Cast Glamour window, choose the base item, then select the glamour you wish to cast from the list of available items.
The presence of a glamour is indicated by a symbol in the upper right corner of the item icon.
Additionally, the item help window will display the name of the original item followed by the name of the glamoured item in alternating sequence.

Glamour prisms can be purchased from the market board, obtained from Grand Company quartermasters, or crafted using recipes learned from glamour prism recipe tomes.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Glamour prism recipe tomes can be purchased from Goberin in western Thanalan (X:12.1 Y:15.0) or Tataroga in Mor Dhona (X:22.1 Y:6.7) after completing the quest <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>“Absolutely Glamourous”<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in western Thanalan (X:12.6 Y:14.3).

Restoring a glamoured item to its original appearance requires the use of <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>glamour dispellers<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>, which are available for purchase from the market boards or certain vendors.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>From the Cast Glamour window, select the glamoured item on the left, then select Remove on the right. This action will consume a glamour dispeller.

You will not be able to cast a glamour if:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>1. Gear can be rendered invisible when glamoured with emperor's new items of the same gear category.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>These invisible items can be purchased from Goberin in western Thanalan (X:12.1 Y:15.0) or Tataroga in Mor Dhona (X:22.1 Y:6.7) after completing the quest <hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>“Absolutely Glamourous”<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> in western Thanalan (X:12.6 Y:14.3).

Basics of Combat
Attack Markers
Some enemy attacks will show an indication of where they will strike in the form of a marker. In most cases, you can avoid taking damage by moving outside of the highlighted area before it lands.
These markers take many forms.
Enmity

Enmity is the priority system by which an enemy chooses a target. All players entered into combat with the enemy generate enmity through dealing damage or healing allies.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>There are two ways to check your current enmity level:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>①The Enmity List<hex:02100103>The enmity list shows all enemies with whom you have generated enmity. The icon on the left indicates your current enmity level. The four levels are displayed below in order of greatest to least.

②The Party List<hex:02100103>The party list shows each party member's enmity level with the currently selected enemy, as indicated in the lower left corner of the class/job icon.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>The player with the greatest enmity is marked with A, followed by 2, 3, and so on. The adjacent gauge shows the relative difference in enmity compared to the player with the most.

During party combat, if you find that the enemies are swarming you instead of the tank, you may wish to withhold your attacks until the tank has regained enmity.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■ Tank Stance<hex:02100103>Each tank job has a special action that helps to keep their enmity level high.

With tank stance active, attacks dealt to enemies will generate significantly higher enmity, controlling the focus of enemy attacks and thereby helping to keep allies safe. This is a key aspect of playing as a tank in party combat.
Enhancements and Enfeeblements

An enhancement is a status effect that strengthens the player, whereas an enfeeblement is one that weakens the player. The icons for enhancements and enfeeblements you receive will appear in the Status Effects element of your HUD layout.

Enhancements have icons shaped like upward arrows, whereas enfeeblements are shaped like downward arrows. A white line across the top of the icon indicates that the enfeeblement can be removed with certain healing actions such as Esuna.
Types of Markers
Targeting Markers
This marker indicates that you have been targeted with some manner of attack.
The specifics of the ensuing attack will vary depending on the enemy and/or duty, but in all cases, it will involve you in some way.
Area of Effect Markers
This marker indicates that you have been targeted with an area of effect attack. Targeted players should move away from their allies, and vice versa.
Stack Markers

This marker indicates that a powerful area of effect attack is imminent. As a stack marker is all but impossible to survive alone, it is imperative that the targeted player stand with as many allies as possible to divide the damage evenly.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Note that there are two different types of stack marker:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■ Circle Stack
■ Line Stack
Lethal Attack Markers

This marker warns of an incredibly powerful attack. Typically, it targets the player with the most enmity, and because it deals tremendous damage, most non-tank jobs are unlikely to survive it.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Should you be targeted, your defensive abilities can help keep you safe. For example, tanks can use Rampart to lower damage sustained as well as Reprisal to lower enemy damage output. For all other roles, check the Actions & Traits menu to see which defensive abilities your job can learn.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Note that there are a few different markers, each with different areas of effect:
■ Solo Marker<hex:02100103>Depending on the enemy, these may inflict an area of effect attack.
■ Area of Effect Marker
■ Line / Cleave Marker<hex:02100103>These attacks will strike the entire area behind the target.
■ Stack Marker<hex:02100103>The spheres orbiting the center indicate how many players are needed to withstand the attack.
Homing Area of Effect Markers

This marker indicates that you will be chased by a series of area of effect attacks targeting your current location.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Because these attacks will strike rapidly and repeatedly, the best course of action is to stay on the move, away from your allies.
Knockback Markers

This marker indicates that a knockback attack is imminent. When it strikes, you will be pushed a set distance away from the point of impact based on your relative location. Keep this in mind and either position yourself accordingly or use an action that nullifies knockback effects.

Note that there are different types of knockback:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■ Radial Knockback<hex:02100103>Players will be pushed outwards from the point of impact. If the marker is purple, like this one, it cannot be nullified by job actions.
■ Directional Knockback<hex:02100103>Players will be pushed in a single set direction.
Area of Effect Knockback Markers

This area of effect marker has an accompanying knockback effect. When it strikes, you will be pushed a set distance away from the point of impact based on your relative location. You will take damage if you stand inside its bounds, so you should position yourself along its outer edges.
If the marker is purple, like this one, it cannot be nullified by job actions.
Flare Markers
This marker indicates that a proximity-based area of effect attack is imminent. The closer you stand to its point of impact, the more damage you will take, so retreat as far as you can.
Sometimes these proximity attacks will target a specific player. To minimize damage, the target should move away from the rest of their party, and vice versa.
Tower Markers
This marker indicates that a tower attack is imminent. If left unoccupied by at least one player, the entire party will take significant damage.
Note that there are different tower markers with different effects:<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■ Tank Tower<hex:02100103>This type of tower hits especially hard. Only a tank should occupy it.

■ Multi-player Towers<hex:02100103>Some towers require a specific number of players to fully absorb the attack. This number will be indicated by the marker. Displayed below are two examples of two-player towers.
Proximity Tether Markers

This spiky marker indicates that you have been tethered to a hostile force. Remain in close proximity and you will receive some manner of negative effect, be it damage or an enfeeblement.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Fortunately, this type of tether can be negated by moving away until the spikes disappear, like so:

Another type of proximity tether, also known as a chain, will continuously damage both players to whom it is connected so long as they remain in close proximity of one another. Affected players can break this tether by moving away from each other.
Interceptible Tether Markers
This marker indicates that an attack will strike the current target. Depending on the situation, it may be necessary for a player to intercept it by physically blocking it from its target.
Gaze Markers

This marker indicates that a gaze attack is imminent. Any player facing the enemy when this attack strikes will receive some manner of negative effect. Alternatively, sometimes the gaze marker will originate from a player instead.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>In both cases, it can be negated by facing away from its source before the attack strikes.
Other Markers

Here you will find descriptions of other attack markers encountered in combat.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>■ Number Markers<hex:02100103>These markers indicate the order in which players will be attacked, starting with the player whose marker has the fewest orbs.
■ Multi-player Markers<hex:02100103>This marker indicates the number of players who must stand together to survive the attack, as shown by the number of orbs.

■ Countdown Markers<hex:02100103>These markers count down to an imminent attack, and if you are caught doing a forbidden action when it reaches zero, you will be penalized with damage or an enfeeblement.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>All countdown markers serve the same function regardless of enemy or duty, and over time you will learn the forbidden actions typically associated with each one.

Items Comprising an Outfit Glamour

<hex:024804F201FA03><hex:024904F201FB03>Outfit glamours<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103> are a means of projecting the appearance of specific item combinations onto an outfit that can be stored in the glamour dresser. Outfits stored in this manner only take up a single glamour slot.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>As with standard glamours, outfit glamours can be projected onto your gear or added to glamour plates.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>To create an outfit glamour, you must possess the corresponding combination of items of identical quality, and an equivalent number of glamour prisms.
When opening the glamour dresser, outfit glamour-ready items are identified by the button displayed in the Glamour Creation window.

Selecting this button will open the Outfit Glamour Creation window. Here you can select items from your Inventory and Armory Chest to include in the outfit glamour. Gear with condition below 100% cannot be used to form an outfit glamour.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>Unlike standard glamours, the color of dyed gear is not transferred to an outfit glamour.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103><hex:02100103><hex:02100103>※Outfit glamours can still be dyed after being projected onto gear or added to a glamour plate.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>When creating an outfit glamour, several items are combined as an ensemble and saved to the glamour dresser.
You can check which items can be combined to form an outfit glamour by selecting the “View Outfit Glamour-ready Items” subcommand of an outfit glamour-ready item.
Item combinations saved as outfit glamours can be viewed under the Outfits tab of the glamour dresser.

In addition to viewing currently saved outfits under this tab, you can also inspect the individual items that form an outfit by selecting the “Inspect Outfit” subcommand. This subcommand is also accessible via each individual item.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>As with standard glamours, individual items that form part of an outfit glamour are displayed under their corresponding tab in the glamour dresser. These items are identified as such in the corresponding item details window.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103>Restoring an outfit glamour will return each included item to its original form.<hex:02100103><hex:02100103><hex:024804F201F403><hex:024904F201F503>※Specific items from an outfit glamour cannot be restored individually.<hex:0249020103><hex:0248020103>
Cast Bars
Some enemy attacks take time to cast before they strike. A progress bar will appear beside the name of the caster, and once this bar fills completely, the attack will be unleashed.
Note that attacks with no cast time will not display a cast bar.
